benchmark_details.name: WildDESED (Wild Domestic Environment Sound Event Detection)
benchmark_details.overview: The WildDESED dataset is an extension to the DESED dataset, crafted to reflect diverse acoustic variability and complex noises in home settings, enhancing the robustness of sound event detection systems in dynamic domestic environments.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To advance sound event detection (SED) research by providing a dataset representing complex acoustic environments in homes.

data.source: WildDESED dataset synthesized using LLMs and a curated selection of audio noises from AudioSet.
data.annotation: Strong annotations provided for sound events.

methodology.calculation: PSDS scores calculated based on sound event detection performance.
methodology.interpretation: Higher PSDS scores indicate better SED performance under varying noise conditions.
methodology.validation: The effectiveness of models was validated on noise levels using PSDS scores, with comparisons to baseline models.
